channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Thinking about buying an EV? Most are set to become $7,500 more expensive come October
item.description: Carmakers may begin reducing production volumes now in order not to be stuck with excess inventory after September, so buyers only have weeks left to ...

item.title: White House to Start Notifying Countries About Tariffs, Trump Says
item.description: After striking only a few trade deals since declaring a 90-day pause in April, President Trump said he would announce new duties starting Friday.

item.title: Explaining the Roll Cloud Spotted in Portugal This Week
item.description: A “roll cloud” spotted off the coast of Portugal looked like something out of a movie. Here’s the science behind it.

item.title: Russia Hits Ukraine With Large Air Barrage Hours After Trump-Putin Call
item.description: It was the latest in a series of almost weekly large-scale missile and drone attacks. President Trump said he “didn’t make any progress” with Presiden...

item.title: China Sets Steep Duties on European Brandy but Spares Biggest Producers
item.description: Major Cognac companies made concessions to avoid the worst of the penalties, imposed by Beijing in retaliation for E.U. tariffs on Chinese electric ve...

item.title: Trump plans to start notifying countries of U.S. tariffs up to 70%
item.description: Trump told reporters that about “10 or 12” letters would go out Friday, with additional letters coming “over the next few days.”

item.title: Microsoft suspends 3,000 Outlook and Hotmail accounts created by North Korean IT workers
item.description: The company said it discovered a repository of resumes and email accounts the workers are using to apply for jobs.

item.title: Democratic Congressman Suozzi’s $50,000 stock sale took advantage of a loophole in Congressional disclosure rules
item.description: The New York rep never disclosed owning the stock, prompting the question of how he managed to sell a security he didn’t appear to own in the first pl...

item.title: An over-employed engineer was caught secretly working for multiple Silicon Valley startups at once—picking up salary offers of up to $200K per job
item.description: The saga began on Wednesday when the engineer started going viral on social media as startup founders discovered he had worked for multiple companies.

item.title: Rare Cloud Sends Beachgoers Running in Portugal
item.description: A dramatic “roll cloud“ spotted up and down the country’s central coast formed during a weeklong heat wave.

item.title: Heavy Storms Cause Deadly Flooding and Evacuations in Texas
item.description: The authorities confirmed that people had died as a result of the flooding along the Guadalupe River, and urged those living near the river to seek hi...

item.title: Russia Targets Kyiv With Record Number of Drones and Missiles
item.description: President Trump said he “didn’t make any progress” after a call with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, hours before a barrage that Ukraine’s air ...

item.title: Gas Station Explosion Rattles Rome, Injuring Several
item.description: Dozens of people were injured, including 10 police officers and a firefighter, officials said. The cause of the blast was not immediately clear.

item.title: Nuclear Inspectors Leave Iran After Cooperation Halted With U.N. Watchdog
item.description: The withdrawal of international inspectors comes amid heightened concerns that Iran, battered by Israeli and U.S. strikes, may be driven to try to bui...
